alert.note: Alert for Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 5:37PM MDT until August 01 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Plum Bush Creek, Sand Creek, East Fork Plumb Bush Creek and Vega Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodlin School and Last Chance.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
